intro: Farmeria, commonly known as the "buttercup flower," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. These plants are native to various regions of Africa, South America, and parts of Asia. They typically have showy, yellow or orange flowers that resemble those of the buttercup, hence their common name. The leaves are usually palmately lobed, and the stems are often hairy. Farmeria species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant blooms and adaptability to different soil conditions.
